New Zealand February-March Temperature Reconstruction
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
               World Data Center for Paleoclimatology, Boulder   
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
NOTE: PLEASE CITE ORIGINAL REFERENCES WHEN USING THIS DATA!!!!!


NAME OF DATA SET:  New Zealand February-March Temperature Reconstruction
CONTRIBUTORS: Limin Xiong, Jonathan G. Palmer

IGBP PAGES/WDCA CONTRIBUTION SERIES NUMBER: 2000-018

SUGGESTED DATA CITATION: Limin Xiong and Jonathan G. Palmer, 2000, 
New Zealand February-March Temperature Reconstruction.
International Tree-Ring Data Bank.  IGBP PAGES/World Data Center-A for 
Paleoclimatology Data Contribution Series #2000-018.  
NOAA/NGDC Paleoclimatology Program, Boulder CO, USA.

ORIGINAL REFERENCE:
Xiong, L.;  Palmer, J.G. 2000. Reconstruction of New Zealand Temperatures 
Back to AD 1720 Using Libocedrus bidwillii Tree-Rings. 
Climatic Change 45(2): 339-359. 

FUNDING SOURCES:
New Zealand Foundation for Research, Science and Technology (Contract UOA 814)
Lincoln University Doctoral Scholarship
Gordon Williams Postgraduate Fellowship

LAST UPDATE:  3/2000 (Original receipt by WDC-A Paleo)
GEOGRAPHIC REGION: New Zealand
PERIOD OF RECORD: 1720-1987

DESCRIPTION:
The data consists of average February-March temperature and its' upper and 
lower 90% confidence interval. These data are given in degrees centigrade 
which derived from 11 New Zealand cedar (Libocedrus bidwillii Hook. f.) 
ring width chronologies.

DATA:

Year    Lower    Feb-Mar   upper   
        90%      temp.     90%
        interval           interval
